back.Definition: A subtle difference in or shade of meaning, expression, or sound.
Examples: Understanding the nuances of the new AI regulation requires examining its impact on various industries.
The actor conveyed the character's emotions with great nuance.

back.Definition: (Especially of an unwelcome influence or physical effect) Spreading widely throughout an area or a group of people; present in all parts of a thing or place.
Examples: The pervasive influence of social media on modern political discourse is a significant challenge.
A sense of dread was pervasive in the air.
One of the most salient features of effective leadership is clear communication.
He highlighted the salient points of the report.
Personal growth is a multifaceted journey.
The problem is too multifaceted to have a single solution.

back.Definition: The ability, especially of something abstract such as a medical treatment or a policy, to produce a desired or intended result.
Examples: Engineers are constantly working to improve the efficacy of machine learning algorithms.
Studies confirmed the high efficacy of the new drug.

back.Definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model or a distinct set of concepts or thought patterns.
Examples: The development of large language models represents a paradigm shift in AI.
He challenged the prevailing paradigm in his field.
